resources.string: The Individual Typological Questionnaire (ITQ) is an original psychodiagnostic technique developed by Lyudmila Nikolaevna Sobchik based on her own theory of leading trends. These methods are defined by 10 scales.

string.name: create_account
string.u: I want to create an account

resources.string: Do you want to take the test?

1. Extroversion - high scores on the extroversion scale correspond to excessive sociability, which interferes with the purposefulness of actions, increased distractibility, talkativeness, with an excessive number of friends and acquaintances, contacts remain superficial, shallow (many acquaintances – few real friends).

2. Spontaneity - high indicators of the spontaneity scale are characteristic of children with pronounced looseness, a tendency to free self-assertion, striving for leadership or, at least, independence. Any regime framework that restricts their freedom causes opposition and a desire for freedom.

3. Aggressiveness - increased results on the scale of aggressiveness (stenicity) – 4-5 points, on the contrary, indicates expressed self-confidence, desire for self-affirmation, motor activity and independence with low subordination, and with high scores (6 points) indicate excessive activity, impulsive behavior with low subordination, negligence in performing tasks, a tendency to truancy and aggressive behavior, up to obvious malicious hooligan actions.

4. Rigidity - high indicators on the rigidity scale are characteristic of guys with pronounced perseverance (if it concerns achieving a goal) and stubbornness (if it manifests itself in defending their point of view). Their own status is extremely important to them: both from the standpoint of primacy, power, and from the point of view of material well-being.

5. Introversion - on the contrary, guys with a pronounced introversion scale are characterized by silence, isolation, isolation. They are very selective in choosing friends, but they are constant in their attachments. They are thoughtful when studying those subjects that they rate as favorite. They assimilate the material better when they are alone.

6. Sensitivity - the sensitivity scale is distinguished in children with pronounced impressionability, extremely vulnerable, touchy, prone to give depressive reactions when failures occur. They have expressed a desire to exaggerate their guilt in what happened.

7. Anxiety - high indicators on the anxiety scale reveal a type of personality with increased anxiety, and indicate the predominance of such character traits as indecision, a pronounced sense of responsibility, an internal need to meet the requirements of the environment - teachers, parents, class, suspiciousness, fearfulness, a tendency to unreasonable fears.

8. Lability - the lability scale at high rates reflects pronounced emotional instability (lability, mobility). These are children whose mood changes easily - from excessive cheerfulness, talkativeness, ridiculousness to a sharply lowered mood with tears, with violent reactions of distress, accompanied by vegetative manifestations – redness of the face, headaches and other pains, increased pulse, fever, fainting, convulsive twitching, nausea and vomiting.
9. Sincerity - if more than 4 points are calculated on the scale of \"lies\" (insincerity), the data is unreliable
10. Aggravation - if on the scale of \"aggravation\" (emphasizing problems) - more than 4 points, then character traits are emphasized, exaggerated.

We offer you to take a character accentuation test, or a Schmishek questionnaire, and find out which types of accentuation are most pronounced in you. As the name of the test implies, the questionnaire was developed by Shmishek on the basis of the dominant character traits identified by Leonhard for a particular type. This accentuation test consists of 88 questions concerning 10 types of accentuations.

" Read each sentence carefully and evaluate how much what is stated in each of them corresponds to what you usually think, do, experience when someone or something has taken you out of balance, or something is hurting you. You need to click on your answer, after which you will have a button to go to the next question "
